isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - Before 12/06/1994 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CONTROL CABLE REPLACEMENT

step1.para: Disconnect the battery ground cable.
Remove the right and left instrument panel covers.
Remove the cover from the Blend-Air unit housing.
Remove the screw(s) from the cable(s) retaining tab(s) from the cable mounting bracket.
Slide the cables off the door crank.
Remove two screws that fasten the control assembly to the instrument panel. Pull control away from the instrument panel.
Unsnap the cable(s) from the rack and pinion assembly fastened to the back of the control panel and take the "Z" bend end of the cable(s) off the rack.
Remove cable(s) assembly from the vehicle.
Route cable(s) under the instrument panel.
Connect "Z" bend end of the cable(s) to the rack and pinion on the back of the control assembly.
Snap the cable(s) in the slot on the end of the rack and pinion to lock the cable(s) in place.
Position the control assembly in the instrument panel and secure with screws.
Route the temperature control cable through the hole in the Blend-Air housing.

Heater-Only unit: Connect the cable to the blend door crank. Blend-Air unit: Connect the cable to the blend door crank and control link (cable adjuster) on the hot water valve lever. Refer to Figure 14 and Figure 15. Follow the cable color code listed in CONTROL ASSEMBLY, INSTALL.
Install the retainer clip and fasten the cable mounting tab to the mounting bracket.
Fasten the Air Outlet (Defrost) cable to the defrost door crank and install the retainer clips ( Figure 19). Follow the color code listed in Step 1 of CONTROL ASSEMBLY.
Fasten the cable mounting tab to the cable mounting bracket ( Figure 16).
Adjust the cables. Refer to MAINTENANCE.
Seal the cable hole in the Blend-Air unit housing with body sealer.
Replace the covers on the Blend-Air unit and the instrument panel.
Reconnect battery cable.
